channel.title: The Paige Perspective
channel.description: In the podcast, Paige Sandgren (@beefnuggette on IG and creator of the Amazon Evolution Academy for women) shares bits of knowledge regarding training, nutrition, motivation, science, psychology, and human behavior insights. Learn more about her program at www.paigesandgren.com if you want to be a next-level woman with a strong mind & physique.
channel.author: Paige Sandgren
channel.itunes:author: Paige Sandgren
channel.itunes:summary: In the podcast, Paige Sandgren (@beefnuggette on IG and creator of the Amazon Evolution Academy for women) shares bits of knowledge regarding training, nutrition, motivation, science, psychology, and human behavior insights. Learn more about her program at www.paigesandgren.com if you want to be a next-level woman with a strong mind & physique.

item.title: Physical Triggers Of Binge Eating
item.description: Sometimes you have triggers that you don’t even realize, and these are a few to help you NOT binge when it’s easily avoidable.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes you have triggers that you don’t even realize, and these are a few to help you NOT binge when it’s easily avoidable.

item.title: Mindset, Mental Illness, & When Additional Help Is Necessary
item.description: I hope we can start to destigmatize mental illness because sometimes you do need to seek clinical help, and that’s nothing to be ashamed of. While my program does help immensely with changing your outlook on life, setting goals, stopping to binge, etc., it’s certainly not a cure-all.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: I hope we can start to destigmatize mental illness because sometimes you do need to seek clinical help, and that’s nothing to be ashamed of. While my program does help immensely with changing your outlook on life, setting goals, stopping to binge, etc., it’s certainly not a cure-all.

item.title: Building A New Life
item.description: We’re taking the “house building” metaphor to a new level here so you can understand why you can’t build a new life on top of things that no longer serve you.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: We’re taking the “house building” metaphor to a new level here so you can understand why you can’t build a new life on top of things that no longer serve you.

item.title: How Trying NOT To Love Yourself Can Help
item.description: This message is for the competitors or perfectionists of the world. Shift your focus elsewhere...
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: This message is for the competitors or perfectionists of the world. Shift your focus elsewhere...

item.title: Childhood & Why You Binge/Sneak Food
item.description: This episode will encourage you to reflect upon your childhood and might uncover a few reasons why you eat the way you do now... and why you feel guilty about it.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: This episode will encourage you to reflect upon your childhood and might uncover a few reasons why you eat the way you do now... and why you feel guilty about it.

item.title: Alcohol On Holidays
item.description: Don’t let alcohol get the best of you during time with friends or family.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Don’t let alcohol get the best of you during time with friends or family.

item.title: Really Being Real? Or BS?
item.description: Ask yourself this: how real are you being on social media? Do you like the physique of your idols or their personalities more? Do you know the entire context of their lives? If not, why do you compare yourself so much to them?
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Ask yourself this: how real are you being on social media? Do you like the physique of your idols or their personalities more? Do you know the entire context of their lives? If not, why do you compare yourself so much to them?

item.title: Motivation Comes From Yourself
item.description: Motivation isn’t an IG picture, or a Pinterest board, or your favorite quote. It comes from within you, and it’s shaped by your goal, values, and your desire. For more info: www.paigesandgren.com
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Motivation isn’t an IG picture, or a Pinterest board, or your favorite quote. It comes from within you, and it’s shaped by your goal, values, and your desire. For more info: www.paigesandgren.com

item.title: I Love Sour Candy
item.description: Do you feel guilty whenever you eat candy? Do you eat so much of it that your tongue hurts after for days? Yep... I used to be in the same boat too....
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Do you feel guilty whenever you eat candy? Do you eat so much of it that your tongue hurts after for days? Yep... I used to be in the same boat too....

item.title: 4 Reasons Why You Binge
item.description: These are the 4 main reasons why you are binging. Plain and simple. As I discuss in the podcast, reach out if you have questions about these and your life, and you don’t even know where to start. You just know you aren’t as happy as you could be. Email me personally at coaching@paigesandgren.com ♥️
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: These are the 4 main reasons why you are binging. Plain and simple. As I discuss in the podcast, reach out if you have questions about these and your life, and you don’t even know where to start. You just know you aren’t as happy as you could be. Email me personally at coaching@paigesandgren.com ♥️

item.title: Never Judge Anyone! (Here’s Why)
item.description: You never know what someone else is going through, so don’t beat yourself up via comparison AND don’t judge someone before you know their story. Stay kind, friends!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: You never know what someone else is going through, so don’t beat yourself up via comparison AND don’t judge someone before you know their story. Stay kind, friends!

item.title: Binge Eating Awareness Day
item.description: Every Friday will officially be “binge eating awareness day” because this is when it all starts to go downhill... and you know it! Here’s what I used to do during my binges...
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Every Friday will officially be “binge eating awareness day” because this is when it all starts to go downhill... and you know it! Here’s what I used to do during my binges...

item.title: Feel Trapped In Your Body?
item.description: Short PSA for all the women out there who are feeling down about their bodies...
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Short PSA for all the women out there who are feeling down about their bodies...

item.title: Hiding Chocolate In The Checkout Lane
item.description: Do you hide “bad” foods under “good” foods in the checkout lane at the store? Or feel guilty about going to the same store twice in one day to get snacks? If so, this episode is for you.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Do you hide “bad” foods under “good” foods in the checkout lane at the store? Or feel guilty about going to the same store twice in one day to get snacks? If so, this episode is for you.

item.title: Cannabis & Munchies
item.description: I disclose my personal usage/experiences and discuss things you can do when you get the munchies and you can’t stop snacking. 😊 Reach out to me if you have any other questions about my program and being mindful with food to prevent cravings! Coaching@paigesandgren.com
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: I disclose my personal usage/experiences and discuss things you can do when you get the munchies and you can’t stop snacking. 😊 Reach out to me if you have any other questions about my program and being mindful with food to prevent cravings! Coaching@paigesandgren.com

item.title: Why You Need To Face Your Stress
item.description: Stress is inevitable if you aren’t retired; and even so, there will always be SOMETHING in your life to worry about. It’s all relative. You need to learn how to deal with it, or it’ll hold you back. Hence... this episode! Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Stress is inevitable if you aren’t retired; and even so, there will always be SOMETHING in your life to worry about. It’s all relative. You need to learn how to deal with it, or it’ll hold you back. Hence... this episode! Enjoy!

item.title: The Biggest Secret To Results
item.description: This is why people never get results; it’s the exact path I use in my program. Take notes! www.paigesandgren.com
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: This is why people never get results; it’s the exact path I use in my program. Take notes! www.paigesandgren.com

item.title: Old Bodybuilding Pictures
item.description: I came across old pictures today and thought, “holy shit!” Here’s why...
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: I came across old pictures today and thought, “holy shit!” Here’s why...

item.title: Sex & Body Insecurities
item.description: Do you ever look down at your stomach during sex and think, “ugh... I hate how I look...” and wish you could change it? Then listen to this episode.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Do you ever look down at your stomach during sex and think, “ugh... I hate how I look...” and wish you could change it? Then listen to this episode.

item.title: Feeling Down? LISTEN UP
item.description: Steps to take when you’re feeling upset, hurt, alone, etc. Get out of your own head and take on the world again!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Steps to take when you’re feeling upset, hurt, alone, etc. Get out of your own head and take on the world again!

item.title: What Is A “Binge?”
item.description: You can’t see it from the outside - sometimes it’s the feeling you eat from eating something you think you shouldn’t be eating.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: You can’t see it from the outside - sometimes it’s the feeling you eat from eating something you think you shouldn’t be eating.

item.title: I’m Thankful The Modeling Agency Denied Me
item.description: I was almost a model as a child, and I’m damn glad they never called me back on my application. Here’s why...
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: I was almost a model as a child, and I’m damn glad they never called me back on my application. Here’s why...

item.title: Facing Fears
item.description: This episode was recorded off the grid. We discuss fight vs flight and a deeper meaning of fear that holds us back from what we really want in life.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: This episode was recorded off the grid. We discuss fight vs flight and a deeper meaning of fear that holds us back from what we really want in life.

item.title: Exercise For Accepting Setbacks
item.description: Here’s a journal exercise you can do for accepting setbacks or any kind of less-than-ideal situation that has happened to you or around you. It can be fitness related or about relationships, work life, kids, etc. Please reach out and let me know if it has helped you and how so!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Here’s a journal exercise you can do for accepting setbacks or any kind of less-than-ideal situation that has happened to you or around you. It can be fitness related or about relationships, work life, kids, etc. Please reach out and let me know if it has helped you and how so!

item.title: An Exercise For Staying Optimistic
item.description: I learned this exercise from one of my favorite writing professors in undergrad. It’s very helpful when applied to mental health and when viewed in a new perspective. I hope you enjoy it!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: I learned this exercise from one of my favorite writing professors in undergrad. It’s very helpful when applied to mental health and when viewed in a new perspective. I hope you enjoy it!

item.title: Even Coaches Aren’t Perfect
item.description: Guess what? Even coaches aren’t perfect! No one is perfect with eating. So here’s a story to humanize this fact.

item.title: List Everything You Love
item.description: Here’s a powerful exercise to teach you a lesson about how you view yourself. And if you have not already done so, join our free Amazon Evolution Secrets group on Facebook for more tips! Here’s the link to request to join: https://www.facebook.com/groups/2196029787393489

item.title: Body Fat & Taking Up Space
item.description: You need to realize that it’s OK for your body to take up space. When you have this mindset shift, your insecurities surrounding fat loss goals will slowly fall away.

item.itunes:summary: You need to realize that it’s OK for your body to take up space. When you have this mindset shift, your insecurities surrounding fat loss goals will slowly fall away.

item.title: Can You Measure What You Can’t Track?
item.description: How would you measure the intangible things in life?
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: How would you measure the intangible things in life?

item.title: It’s As Complicated And As Simple As That
item.description: Albeit seemingly ambiguous, this phrase can be applied to many situations to reveal deeper truths and thus lead you to making better decisions, harder decisions.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Albeit seemingly ambiguous, this phrase can be applied to many situations to reveal deeper truths and thus lead you to making better decisions, harder decisions.

item.title: Gratitude & Thailand
item.description: What are you grateful for? Don’t take anything for granted!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: What are you grateful for? Don’t take anything for granted!

item.title: Mindset, Cravings, & Binges
item.description: This episode is packed with lots of solid advice, deeper truths, and insight. It’s too much to summarize. Sometimes when you speak from your heart, everything comes out and you just don’t want to stop. Xo
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: This episode is packed with lots of solid advice, deeper truths, and insight. It’s too much to summarize. Sometimes when you speak from your heart, everything comes out and you just don’t want to stop. Xo

item.title: Watching Others Make “Progress”
item.description: Just because you’re not making fat loss progress doesn’t mean you’re not making progress. Listen to this episode to learn why!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Just because you’re not making fat loss progress doesn’t mean you’re not making progress. Listen to this episode to learn why!

item.title: Angry About “Plus Size” Mannequins?
item.description: It’s so much harder to see someone for their health behavior opposed to their weight or clothing size. But what if we did that? What does it really say about someone who is angry about the larger sized clothing that’s now available?
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: It’s so much harder to see someone for their health behavior opposed to their weight or clothing size. But what if we did that? What does it really say about someone who is angry about the larger sized clothing that’s now available?

item.itunes:summary: This is a simple exercise you can do to check yourself and make yourself a little happier each week.

item.title: Your Diet Shouldn’t Be “Good” or “Bad”
item.description: If you describe your diet to be as black and white as this, then you know you need to work on your relationship with food.

item.itunes:summary: If you describe your diet to be as black and white as this, then you know you need to work on your relationship with food.

item.itunes:summary: It only takes a minute to do, so you should probably do it.

item.title: Change Who You Are With What You Do
item.description: If you practice an instrument, you are a musician. If you step in the gym, you are an athlete. Stop doubting yourself - and become yourself.

item.itunes:summary: If you practice an instrument, you are a musician. If you step in the gym, you are an athlete. Stop doubting yourself - and become yourself.

item.title: Does Birth Control Cause Fat Gain?
item.description: Disclaimer: Paige is not a physician and this is not medical advice. This is her personal opinion and what she has seen with what science has proven so far. However, we hope it will help you!

item.itunes:summary: Disclaimer: Paige is not a physician and this is not medical advice. This is her personal opinion and what she has seen with what science has proven so far. However, we hope it will help you!

item.title: Feeling Self-Conscious?
item.description: Everyone remembers this feeling growing up... don’t let it keep affecting you. Start by being aware of it. And know that you are not alone!

item.title: Have You Written Your Own Obituary Yet?

item.title: Too Much Structure, Or Not Enough?
item.description: There are two schools of extreme thought when it comes to the most common mindset issues with food. Listen to this if you want a better relationship with food, because the solution comes when you diagnose the problem.

item.title: JLo... Beyoncé... Diets... Face Palm

item.title: Walking Confidently
item.description: Don’t fake it til you make it, because you never will. Make it and then you can OWN IT. ♥️

item.itunes:summary: Don’t fake it til you make it, because you never will. Make it and then you can OWN IT. ♥️

item.title: Our Darker Thoughts
item.description: Mindset episode! You can’t have light without darkness. If you always pretend life is all sunshine and rainbows, then you are missing out on personal growth.

item.itunes:summary: Mindset episode! You can’t have light without darkness. If you always pretend life is all sunshine and rainbows, then you are missing out on personal growth.

item.title: Travel Tips With Nutrition
item.description: Just some old school nutrition tips on how you “could” stay on track when tracking calories. The best way is to not count... but that’s a process, as you learn in the AEA. www.paigesandgren.com
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Just some old school nutrition tips on how you “could” stay on track when tracking calories. The best way is to not count... but that’s a process, as you learn in the AEA. www.paigesandgren.com

item.title: Think Like A Toddler
item.description: Sometimes we need to see ourselves in the shoes of someone else, our future self, or our former self, in order to see that our current thought processes are actually holding us back from progress. Once you realize that, you’ve freed yourself. That’s pretty bloody cool.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes we need to see ourselves in the shoes of someone else, our future self, or our former self, in order to see that our current thought processes are actually holding us back from progress. Once you realize that, you’ve freed yourself. That’s pretty bloody cool.

item.title: Self-Care Activities
item.description: It’s ironic that some of these self-care activities are things that we wouldn’t even be comfortable with nowadays...
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: It’s ironic that some of these self-care activities are things that we wouldn’t even be comfortable with nowadays...

item.title: Cognitive Distortion & Twisting The Truth
item.description: Wish you could tell your inner critic to STFU sometimes? Our mind plays tricks on us all the time. Cognitive distortion is one way of “telling ourselves stories” as defense mechanisms or justification fronts from insecurities that manifest our mind. They can really hold you back in life. Try these questions to keep yourself in check and to keep fearlessly chasing your goals!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren

Try these questions to keep yourself in check and to keep fearlessly chasing your goals!

item.title: Mind-Muscle Connection Tip

item.title: Why I’m Done With Competitive Bodybuilding (For Now)
item.description: Bodybuilding, special supplements, the “sacrifice it all for the stage” life... there are many things that have gone unsaid that would help others if they were in the open, hence this episode. This is only the tip of the fire. Youtube video coming soon!

item.title: The Age Paradox

item.title: Gym Intimidation & Appearance
item.description: In this episode, we discuss being intimidated in the gym and why the opinions of others really don’t matter at all. You’ve heard it a million times and it clearly still bothers you sometimes, so hopefully this will drive it home one last time. Make a change if you want a different outcome for your life!

item.title: 8 Hours Of Choice Per Day
item.description: We all have the same 8 hours of choice per day to do what we need to and want to. Don’t stress about your 24 hours... prioritize your 8 hours.

item.itunes:summary: We all have the same 8 hours of choice per day to do what we need to and want to. Don’t stress about your 24 hours... prioritize your 8 hours.

item.title: My Personal Fitness Journey

item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Paige discusses personal details of her fitness journey leading up to this point, how she dealt with binge eating in college, and the reason why you can’t be afraid to invest in yourself. Ever.

item.itunes:summary: What does it mean to live a purposeful life? One simple question that we often over complicate.

item.title: Clean Diet, Dirty Mind?
item.description: In this episode, we discuss how a flexible nutrition approach can benefit you mentally. Don’t crave your life away!

item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we discuss how a flexible nutrition approach can benefit you mentally. Don’t crave your life away!

item.title: Questions To Ask Yourself
item.description: In this episode, Paige rambles off some questions that you should take and run with. They seem simple but they lead you to a better understanding of your abilities and will help you achieve your goals.

item.title: A Note On Eating “Disorders”
item.description: You don’t have to be underweight or overweight to have an eating disorder. It’s not always visible. We discuss this plus the stigma of the word “disorder” itself.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: You don’t have to be underweight or overweight to have an eating disorder. It’s not always visible. We discuss this plus the stigma of the word “disorder” itself.

item.title: Your Body Is Like A Bank Account
item.description: This is a pretty cool metaphor that I stumbled across and thought I would share!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: This is a pretty cool metaphor that I stumbled across and thought I would share!

item.title: Do Injuries Make You Stressed?
item.description: Have you ever received heavy news like an injury that will lay you up for a while, and you immediately become depressed? You assume you will fall out of shape? Why is that? We explore these reasons in this episode. Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever received heavy news like an injury that will lay you up for a while, and you immediately become depressed? You assume you will fall out of shape? Why is that? We explore these reasons in this episode. Enjoy!

item.title: Stop Avoiding The Pain
item.description: In this episode, we discuss what procrastination really means and reiterate why your own apprehensions are holding you back. Yes, there’s also a new intro and outro, yo ;)
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we discuss what procrastination really means and reiterate why your own apprehensions are holding you back. Yes, there’s also a new intro and outro, yo ;)

item.title: The Only Thing Better Than Motivation
item.description: You can’t keep relying on daily motivation if you want to reach your goals. Motivation is subjective, fleeting, and unpredictable. Why would you rely on something like that?
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: You can’t keep relying on daily motivation if you want to reach your goals. Motivation is subjective, fleeting, and unpredictable. Why would you rely on something like that?

item.title: Mindset Shift: Add Food, Don’t Subtract
item.description: This is one of the many subtle mindset hacks you can do to improve your relationship with food.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: This is one of the many subtle mindset hacks you can do to improve your relationship with food.

item.title: What Everyone Needs To Know When “Researching” Diets
item.description: On this episode, you’ll learn why you shouldn’t be so quick to trust experts or those with credentials. This includes doctors/PhD recipients, CEOs, fit celebrities like Mark Wahlberg & their trainers, and even Dr. Oz. Everyone is biased, so the only way to do “true” research is to look at the real studies and watch out for correlation vs causation, cherry picking, and marketing.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: On this episode, you’ll learn why you shouldn’t be so quick to trust experts or those with credentials. item.title: Why Do People Hate Tony Robbins?
item.description: Everything is on a spectrum. In this random stream of consciousness, Paige discusses how humans have this innate desire to judge, seemingly in order to understand, and how that’s simultaneously just a waste of time. We don’t always see it this way because of short term gratification.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren

item.title: A Lost Gem: Phone Calls
item.description: While all of this technology nowadays does help improve productivity, there’s still something to be said about the basics and being efficient.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: While all of this technology nowadays does help improve productivity, there’s still something to be said about the basics and being efficient.

item.title: Climbing Mountains
item.description: On this episode, Paige uses a common metaphor to examine how athletic aspirations and extreme life accomplishments could positively or negatively affect your life, and why it’s important to be proactively self-aware as your perspective changes overtime.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: On this episode, Paige uses a common metaphor to examine how athletic aspirations and extreme life accomplishments could positively or negatively affect your life, and why it’s important to be proactively self-aware as your perspective changes overtime.

item.title: I Was An Introvert... But I Grew
item.description: Paige gets personal on this episode and discusses her experience growing up as an introvert and explains how she has changed over the years.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Paige gets personal on this episode and discusses her experience growing up as an introvert and explains how she has changed over the years.

item.title: Stop Labeling Food As “Healthy”
item.description: “Healthy” is a subjective term. Listen to the podcast to learn more about why calories matter, how the glycemic index DOESN’T matter, and why you’re probably avoiding foods that you actually don’t have to avoid in order to improve your biomarkers and body composition.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: “Healthy” is a subjective term. Listen to the podcast to learn more about why calories matter, how the glycemic index DOESN’T matter, and why you’re probably avoiding foods that you actually don’t have to avoid in order to improve your biomarkers and body composition.

item.title: Once Upon A Time, A Girl Tried Every Fad Diet
item.description: This girl that I’m referring to is me. People can often look at a physique and forget how long it took to build it, and how that person has changed over time. I used to be the average girl next door who was skinny fat, and now look where I am. It didn’t happen by chance.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren

item.title: Introducing New Habits
item.description: On this episode, Paige discusses the rate at which to introduce new habits into your life. You need to minimize stress but also maximize your efficiency, and that starts with organization.
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: On this episode, Paige discusses the rate at which to introduce new habits into your life. You need to minimize stress but also maximize your efficiency, and that starts with organization.

item.title: The Importance Of Point A & Point B
item.description: Think of your life as a map. You might be able to use a compass, but you’ll never get to point B (your goals) if you never figure out your point A (your current location).
item.dc:creator: Paige Sandgren
item.itunes:summary: Think of your life as a map. You might be able to use a compass, but you’ll never get to point B (your goals) if you never figure out your point A (your current location).

item.title: 8 Reasons Why You Don’t Have Your Dream Body Yet
item.description: In order to change anything, you need to first be aware of the facts. Where are you today? What is your life like? What could be holding you back? It’s not always easy for ya to see because this is often painful, so we avoid the truth. Unfortunately, that’s not how you will grow. THIS is where growth starts. It starts now, and it starts with the facts.
